name: coffee maker production | coffee maker | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20455/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average coffee maker which is approximately 1.9 kg in mass and has a rating of 640 W. It has the envisaged lifetime of 5 years and is manufactured in Asia. The figures on material inputs from technosphere and energy required to produce an average coffee maker are taken from Ashby 2009. The figure on the annual production volume (3400000 units) is calculated from Future Market Insights 2018. This figure represents the annual production forecast for 2026 and combines coffee makers produced for coffee shops (1000000 units) and for in-home consumption (2400000 units). Future Market Insights 2018 forecast a 6% growth throughout to 2026. This suggests that, in 2018, the annual production volume approximately equates to 3200000 units of coffee makers.

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average coffee maker. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to the underpinning technology as being current.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average coffee maker. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Asia.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Asia.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The figure on the annual world production volume (3400000 units) is calculated from Future Market Insights 2018. This figure represents the annual production forecast for 2026 and combines coffee makers produced for coffee shops (1000000 units) and for in-home consumption (2400000 units). Future Market Insights 2018 forecast a 6% growth throughout to 2026. This suggests that, in 2018, the annual production volume approximately equates to 3200000 units.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Ashby 2009. Data on the annual production volume are calculated based on the worldwide production forecast for 2026 taken from Future Market Insights 2018. These include coffee makers manufactured for in-home and out-of-home (coffee shops and other hospitality ventures) consumption. Sources: Ashby, M.F., 2009. Materials and the Environment. Eco-informed material choice. Elsevier, Oxford, 2009. Future Market Insights 2018. Automatic coffee machine market to grow at a CAGR of 6.0% through 2016, globally - Future Market Insights. Available from: https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2018/01/09/1285914/0/en/Automatic-Coffee-Machine-Market-to-Grow-at-a-CAGR-of-6-0-through-2026-globally-Future-Market-Insights.html (Accessed 11 January 2018).

exchanges.description: Annual production volume is from Future Market Insights 2018. Automatic coffee machine market to grow at a CAGR of 6.0% through 2016, globally - Future Market Insights. Available from: https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2018/01/09/1285914/0/en/Automatic-Coffee-Machine-Market-to-Grow-at-a-CAGR-of-6-0-through-2026-globally-Future-Market-Insights.html Accessed 11 January 2018.

exchanges.description: Used here in place of infrastructure based on the amount of the largest contributor to the final product mass (polypropylene). This is an estimated value. According to the technology comment of the dataset 'Plastic processing factory construction, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018], the life time of the tanks is assumed to be 50 years and the annual production is 27000 t/a. Thus, the estimated lifetime output of the factory is 27000 x 50 = 1350000. As the coffee machine mass is 1.9 kg, then the number of coffee machines produced during the lifetime of the factory is 1350000 / 0.0019 = 710526316 units. The calculation of the infrastructure is therefore 1/life time capacity = 1/710526316 unit.
